meanings.definition: A particular area or neighborhood, especially as regarded as a place occupied by certain people or as the scene of particular activities.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 特定的地区或社区，尤其是被特定人群占据或发生特定活动的地方。

examples.english: Crime rates have decreased in this locality over the past year.
examples.chinese: 在过去的一年里，这个地区的犯罪率有所下降。

meanings.definition: The position or site of something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 某物的位置或场所。

examples.english: The exact locality of the buried treasure remains unknown.
examples.chinese: 埋藏宝藏的确切位置仍然未知。

meanings.definition: A round plane figure whose boundary consists of points equidistant from a fixed point.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一种平面图形，其边界上的所有点到一个固定点的距离相等。

examples.english: The children sat in a circle during story time.
examples.chinese: 孩子们在讲故事时围坐成一个圆圈。

meanings.definition: A group of people with a shared profession, interests, or acquaintances.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 有共同职业、兴趣或熟人的一群人。

examples.english: She moves in artistic circles in the city.
examples.chinese: 她在城里的艺术圈子里活动。

meanings.definition: To move in a circular direction around something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 围绕某物做圆周运动。

examples.english: The vultures circled above the desert looking for food.
examples.chinese: 秃鹰在沙漠上空盘旋寻找食物。

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being correct or precise.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 正确或精确的品质或状态。

examples.english: The accuracy of her predictions was remarkable.
examples.chinese: 她预测的准确性令人惊叹。

meanings.definition: The degree to which the result of a measurement, calculation, or specification conforms to the correct value or a standard.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 测量、计算或规格的结果符合正确值或标准的程度。

examples.english: The instrument measures with an accuracy of 0.01 millimeters.
examples.chinese: 该仪器测量的精度为0.01毫米。

meanings.definition: To allow the existence, occurrence, or practice of (something that one dislikes or disagrees with) without interference.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 允许（自己不喜欢或不同意的事物）的存在、发生或实践而不加干涉。

examples.english: She won't tolerate any form of dishonesty in her business.
examples.chinese: 她在生意上不会容忍任何形式的不诚实。

meanings.definition: To be capable of continued subjection to (a drug, toxin, or environmental condition) without adverse reaction.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 能够持续承受（药物、毒素或环境条件）而不产生不良反应。

examples.english: Some patients cannot tolerate this medication due to its side effects.
examples.chinese: 一些患者因为副作用而无法耐受这种药物。

meanings.definition: To have enough money to pay for something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 有足够的钱支付某物。

examples.english: They can't afford to buy a new car this year.
examples.chinese: 他们今年买不起新车。

meanings.definition: To provide or supply (an opportunity or facility).
meanings.chineseDefinition: 提供或供应（机会或设施）。

examples.english: The hill affords a wonderful view of the valley.
examples.chinese: 从这座山上可以看到山谷的美景。

meanings.definition: To be able to spare or give up (something).
meanings.chineseDefinition: 能够抽出或放弃（某事物）。

examples.english: We can't afford to lose any more time on this project.
examples.chinese: 我们不能在这个项目上再浪费时间了。

meanings.definition: Extremely good; outstanding.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 极好的；杰出的。

examples.english: The food at the restaurant was excellent.
examples.chinese: 这家餐厅的食物非常棒。

meanings.definition: Used to express approval or pleasure.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 用于表示赞同或愉悦。

examples.english: "You've finished the report already? Excellent!" she exclaimed.
examples.chinese: "你已经完成报告了？太好了！"她惊呼道。

meanings.definition: To join or link two or more things together.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 将两个或多个事物连接或链接在一起。

examples.english: The bridge connects the island to the mainland.
examples.chinese: 这座桥将岛屿与大陆连接起来。

meanings.definition: To associate or relate in some respect.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在某些方面联系或关联。

examples.english: The police couldn't connect him to the crime.
examples.chinese: 警方无法将他与这起犯罪联系起来。

meanings.definition: To establish a rapport or relationship with someone.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与某人建立融洽关系或联系。

examples.english: I really connected with my new colleagues at the conference.
examples.chinese: 我在会议上真的与我的新同事建立了联系。

meanings.definition: A solid geometric figure with straight parallel sides and a circular or oval cross section.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一种几何立体，具有直平行边和圆形或椭圆形横截面。

examples.english: The mathematician drew a perfect cylinder on the board.
examples.chinese: 数学家在黑板上画了一个完美的圆柱体。

meanings.definition: A chamber in an engine in which a piston travels.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 发动机中活塞运动的腔室。

examples.english: The car has a powerful eight-cylinder engine.
examples.chinese: 这辆车有一个强大的八缸发动机。

meanings.definition: A container of compressed gas.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 压缩气体的容器。

examples.english: The divers carried oxygen cylinders on their backs.
examples.chinese: 潜水员背着氧气瓶。

meanings.definition: A condition or circumstance that puts one in an unfavorable or inferior position.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 使人处于不利或劣势地位的条件或环境。

examples.english: The team's main disadvantage was their lack of experience.
examples.chinese: 这个团队的主要劣势是缺乏经验。

meanings.definition: To put in an unfavorable position.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 使处于不利地位。

examples.english: The new tax laws disadvantage small businesses.
examples.chinese: 新的税法使小企业处于不利地位。

meanings.definition: To take part in an activity or event.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 参加活动或事件。

examples.english: Over a hundred students participated in the science fair.
examples.chinese: 一百多名学生参加了科学展览会。

meanings.definition: To share in something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 分享某事物。

examples.english: All employees will participate in the company's profit-sharing plan.
examples.chinese: 所有员工都将参与公司的利润分享计划。

meanings.definition: A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior or for a chain of reasoning.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 作为信仰或行为系统或推理链基础的基本真理或命题。

examples.english: The principles of democracy include freedom and equality.
examples.chinese: 民主的原则包括自由和平等。

meanings.definition: A rule or belief governing one's behavior.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 支配一个人行为的规则或信念。

examples.english: She refused the bribe as a matter of principle.
examples.chinese: 她原则上拒绝了贿赂。

meanings.definition: A general scientific theorem or law that has numerous special applications across a wide field.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在广泛领域有众多特殊应用的一般科学定理或定律。

examples.english: The principle of conservation of energy is fundamental to physics.
examples.chinese: 能量守恒原理是物理学的基础。

meanings.definition: Food and drink provided at a meeting, event, or during a journey.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在会议、活动或旅途中提供的食物和饮料。

examples.english: Refreshments will be served after the presentation.
examples.chinese: 演讲结束后将提供茶点。

meanings.definition: The act of refreshing or the state of being refreshed.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 提神或被提神的行为或状态。

examples.english: A short walk provided welcome refreshment after hours of studying.
examples.chinese: 在数小时的学习后，短暂的散步提供了令人愉快的精神恢复。

meanings.definition: To become progressively worse.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 变得越来越糟。

examples.english: His health deteriorated rapidly after the diagnosis.
examples.chinese: 诊断后，他的健康状况迅速恶化。

meanings.definition: To make something worse.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 使某事物变得更糟。

examples.english: The harsh chemicals deteriorated the fabric over time.
examples.chinese: 随着时间的推移，刺激性化学物质使织物变质。

meanings.definition: Very hot.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 非常热的。

examples.english: It was a scorching summer day with temperatures above 40°C.
examples.chinese: 那是一个酷热的夏日，气温超过40°C。

meanings.definition: Severe or scathing.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 严厉的或尖刻的。

examples.english: The film received a scorching review from the critics.
examples.chinese: 这部电影受到了评论家的严厉批评。

meanings.definition: The action of burning or damaging something with heat.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 用热烧灼或损坏某物的行为。

examples.english: The scorching of the fabric was visible where the iron had been too hot.
examples.chinese: 在熨斗太热的地方，布料的烧焦痕迹很明显。

meanings.definition: The time between two events; an interval.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 两个事件之间的时间；间隔。

examples.english: In the meantime, we'll have to make do with what we have.
examples.chinese: 在此期间，我们必须凑合着用我们现有的东西。

meanings.definition: During the intervening time.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在此期间。

examples.english: We're waiting for the new equipment to arrive; meantime, we'll use the old system.
examples.chinese: 我们正在等待新设备到达；同时，我们将使用旧系统。

meanings.definition: The visual appearance of a town or urban area; an urban landscape.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 城镇或城市地区的视觉外观；城市景观。

examples.english: The historic buildings are an important part of the townscape.
examples.chinese: 这些历史建筑是城市景观的重要组成部分。

meanings.definition: A picture or representation of an urban scene.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 城市场景的图片或表现形式。

examples.english: The artist is known for his detailed townscapes of Victorian London.
examples.chinese: 这位艺术家以其对维多利亚时期伦敦的详细城市风景画而闻名。

meanings.definition: Situated above another part.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 位于另一部分之上的。

examples.english: The injury affected his upper back.
examples.chinese: 这个伤害影响了他的上背部。

meanings.definition: Of higher rank or position in a hierarchy.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在等级制度中具有较高等级或地位的。

examples.english: The decision was made by upper management.
examples.chinese: 这个决定是由高层管理人员做出的。

meanings.definition: The part of a shoe or boot above the sole.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 鞋子或靴子鞋底以上的部分。

examples.english: The uppers of these boots are made of genuine leather.
examples.chinese: 这些靴子的鞋面是用真皮制成的。

meanings.definition: Not guilty of a crime or offense.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 没有犯罪或过错。

examples.english: The jury found him innocent of all charges.
examples.chinese: 陪审团认定他所有指控均无罪。

meanings.definition: Free from moral wrong; not corrupted.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 没有道德过错；未被腐蚀的。

examples.english: She had an innocent smile that charmed everyone.
examples.chinese: 她有一个纯真的微笑，迷住了每个人。

meanings.definition: Not experienced or worldly; naive.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 没有经验或世故；天真的。

examples.english: He was innocent about the ways of the world.
examples.chinese: 他对世界的运作方式很天真。

meanings.definition: A person who is innocent of wrongdoing or corruption.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一个没有做错事或没有腐败的人。

examples.english: The war claimed the lives of many innocents.
examples.chinese: 战争夺走了许多无辜者的生命。

meanings.definition: Special importance, value, or prominence given to something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 给予某事物的特别重要性、价值或突出性。

examples.english: The school places great emphasis on academic achievement.
examples.chinese: 学校非常重视学术成就。

meanings.definition: Stress laid on a word or words to indicate special meaning or importance.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在词或词语上加的重音，以表示特殊含义或重要性。

examples.english: She repeated the word with emphasis to make her point clear.
examples.chinese: 她强调地重复这个词，以使她的观点清晰。

meanings.definition: To come near or nearer to something or someone in distance or time.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在距离或时间上接近或更接近某物或某人。

examples.english: As we approached the city, the traffic became heavier.
examples.chinese: 当我们接近城市时，交通变得更加拥挤。

meanings.definition: To speak to someone about something, especially for the first time.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与某人谈论某事，尤其是第一次。

examples.english: He approached his boss about a raise.
examples.chinese: 他向老板提出加薪的事。

meanings.definition: A way of dealing with something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 处理某事的方式。

examples.english: We need a different approach to solving this problem.
examples.chinese: 我们需要一种不同的方法来解决这个问题。

meanings.definition: The action of coming near or nearer to someone or something in distance or time.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在距离或时间上接近或更接近某人或某物的行动。

examples.english: At the approach of winter, the birds migrate south.
examples.chinese: 随着冬天的临近，鸟儿向南迁徙。

meanings.definition: The time during which something continues.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 某事物持续的时间。

examples.english: The duration of the concert was about two hours.
examples.chinese: 音乐会的持续时间约为两个小时。

meanings.definition: The length of time something lasts or continues.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 某事物持续或继续的时间长度。

examples.english: The treatment is of short duration but highly effective.
examples.chinese: 这种治疗时间短但非常有效。

meanings.definition: For the most part; mainly.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 大部分；主要地。

examples.english: The company is primarily concerned with maximizing profits.
examples.chinese: 该公司主要关注的是利润最大化。

meanings.definition: In the first place; originally.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 首先；最初。

examples.english: She came to the city primarily to study, but also enjoyed the cultural opportunities.
examples.chinese: 她来到这座城市主要是为了学习，但也享受文化机会。

meanings.definition: Expected at or planned for at a certain time.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在某个特定时间预期或计划的。

examples.english: The train is due at 3:15 pm.
examples.chinese: 火车预计下午3:15到达。

meanings.definition: Required or owed as a legal or moral obligation.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 作为法律或道德义务所要求或欠下的。

examples.english: Payment is due at the end of the month.
examples.chinese: 付款期限是月底。

meanings.definition: Proper, adequate, or appropriate.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 适当的、充分的或恰当的。

examples.english: The matter was given due consideration.
examples.chinese: 此事得到了适当的考虑。

meanings.definition: Something that rightfully belongs to someone.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 理应属于某人的东西。

examples.english: Give credit where credit is due.
examples.chinese: 功劳应该归于有功之人。

meanings.definition: Having or showing eagerness or enthusiasm.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 有或表现出热切或热情。

examples.english: She's very keen on the idea of starting her own business.
examples.chinese: 她对创办自己的企业的想法非常热衷。

meanings.definition: Having a sharp cutting edge or point.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 有锋利的切割边缘或尖端。

examples.english: The chef carefully sharpened his keen knife.
examples.chinese: 厨师小心地磨快了他锋利的刀。

meanings.definition: Intellectually sharp; mentally acute.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 智力敏锐；精神敏锐。

examples.english: She has a keen mind and quickly grasps complex concepts.
examples.chinese: 她思维敏捷，能够快速理解复杂的概念。

meanings.definition: To wail in grief for a dead person; to lament.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 为死者哀号；哀悼。

examples.english: The women keened over the body of the deceased.
examples.chinese: 女人们在死者的尸体旁哀号。

meanings.definition: Any of numerous relatively small elongated soft-bodied invertebrate animals such as an earthworm or nematode.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 许多相对较小的细长软体无脊椎动物，如蚯蚓或线虫。

examples.english: After the rain, worms came to the surface of the garden.
examples.chinese: 雨后，蚯蚓浮到了花园的表面。

meanings.definition: A weak or despicable person (used as a term of contempt).
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一个软弱或卑鄙的人（用作蔑称）。

examples.english: You miserable worm! How dare you speak to me like that!
examples.chinese: 你这个可怜虫！你怎么敢那样对我说话！

meanings.definition: A program that replicates itself and spreads to other computers typically without human assistance.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一种能够自我复制并传播到其他计算机的程序，通常无需人工协助。

examples.english: The computer worm infected thousands of systems within hours.
examples.chinese: 这个计算机蠕虫在几小时内感染了数千个系统。

meanings.definition: To move with a crawling or wriggling motion.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 以爬行或扭动的方式移动。

examples.english: He wormed his way through the narrow tunnel.
examples.chinese: 他蠕动着穿过狭窄的隧道。

meanings.definition: To obtain information from someone by cunning persistence.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 通过狡猾的坚持从某人那里获取信息。

examples.english: She tried to worm the secret out of him.
examples.chinese: 她试图套出他的秘密。

meanings.definition: Not easily bent or changed in shape; rigid.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不易弯曲或改变形状的；僵硬的。

examples.english: The door was stuck because of the stiff hinges.
examples.chinese: 门因为铰链僵硬而卡住了。

meanings.definition: Not moving or working easily.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不易移动或工作的。

examples.english: My neck is stiff from sleeping in an awkward position.
examples.chinese: 因为睡姿不当，我的脖子很僵硬。

meanings.definition: Difficult or severe; harsh.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 困难或严厉的；严酷的。

examples.english: The company faces stiff competition in the market.
examples.chinese: 公司在市场上面临激烈的竞争。

meanings.definition: Completely or extremely.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 完全地或极度地。

examples.english: He was frozen stiff in the cold weather.
examples.chinese: 在寒冷的天气里，他冻得僵硬。

meanings.definition: A dead body; a corpse.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 死尸；尸体。

examples.english: The detective examined the stiff for any clues.
examples.chinese: 侦探检查尸体寻找线索。

meanings.definition: To fail to give (someone) something promised or expected, especially money.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 未能给予（某人）承诺或期望的东西，尤指钱。

examples.english: He stiffed the waiter on the tip.
examples.chinese: 他没有给服务员小费。

meanings.definition: Wood prepared for use in building and carpentry.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 为建筑和木工准备的木材。

examples.english: The house was built entirely of local timber.
examples.chinese: 这所房子完全由当地木材建造。

meanings.definition: Trees grown for wood.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 为木材而种植的树木。

examples.english: They own several acres of timber in the mountains.
examples.chinese: 他们在山区拥有几英亩的林木。

meanings.definition: A large wooden beam or post used as a structural element.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 用作结构元素的大型木梁或木柱。

examples.english: The old barn had massive oak timbers supporting the roof.
examples.chinese: 这座旧谷仓有巨大的橡木梁支撑屋顶。

meanings.definition: The distinctive character or quality of a person's voice.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一个人声音的独特特性或品质。

examples.english: The timber of his voice was deep and resonant.
examples.chinese: 他的嗓音深沉而洪亮。

meanings.definition: Very great or intense.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 非常巨大或强烈的。

examples.english: The news of her death came as a profound shock.
examples.chinese: 她去世的消息带来了极大的震惊。

meanings.definition: Having or showing great knowledge or insight.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 具有或表现出丰富的知识或洞察力。

examples.english: Her book offers a profound analysis of modern society.
examples.chinese: 她的书提供了对现代社会的深刻分析。

meanings.definition: Very deep; extending far below the surface.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 很深的；延伸到表面以下很远。

examples.english: The divers explored the profound depths of the ocean.
examples.chinese: 潜水员探索了海洋的深处。

meanings.definition: A person who collects, writes, and distributes news and other information.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 收集、撰写和发布新闻及其他信息的人。

examples.english: She works as a journalist for a major newspaper.
examples.chinese: 她在一家主要报纸担任记者。

meanings.definition: A person who keeps a journal or diary.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 保持日记或日志的人。

examples.english: As a meticulous journalist, he recorded every detail of his travels.
examples.chinese: 作为一个细致的记录者，他记录了旅行的每一个细节。

meanings.definition: The action of officially allowing someone to do a particular thing; consent or authorization.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 正式允许某人做特定事情的行为；同意或授权。

examples.english: You need permission from your parents to go on the field trip.
examples.chinese: 你需要父母的许可才能去实地考察。

meanings.definition: The right to do something granted by a person or organization with authority.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 由有权威的人或组织授予的做某事的权利。

examples.english: We have permission to use the images in our publication.
examples.chinese: 我们有权在我们的出版物中使用这些图片。
